answers.answer: What are the doctors reasons for doing the amnio?  I'm sorry I don't have any experience to share with you, I've never had to have one.

I am so sorry you are having such a hard time. I had amnio  done at 35 wks. For me I was really scared as well. But it actually wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. It was very fast and just felt like a normal shot. When my results came back the babys lungs were not mature enough. So they waited a week and delivered him at 36 wks. 3 days and he was perfectly heathly. Good luck to you. Your almost there!!

Hey! I had an amnio at 24 weeks with my last son and as scary and stressful as the thought of it can be it really isn't that bad. I absolutely hate shots and having my blood drawn but the amnio didn't hurt a single bit. Just think of it this way, your doctor is trying to give your baby the best start by making sure it's lungs are mature and all it is is just that =) I hope that everything goes well for you =)

question: I am 32 weeks pregnant... and I am very high risk.  I am 41, I have had pre-eclampsia with all of my pregnancies (4 total) and have type 2 diabetes.  My last pregnancy ended with a placental abruption, emergency c-section and 4 months later we lost our son due to a heart defect.  My current pregnancy is going well for the baby... I'm just doing horrible.  I have been on bed rest since 26 weeks, I have been hospitalized twice due to high blood pressure and even though I am doing better, the dr's don't want me going longer than necessary.  My dr. wants to do an amnio in a month (if I make it that long) that will make me 35/36 weeks.  I'm very scared about this test... I have never had it done.  Some people says it hurts... others say it is not so bad... what do I expect????  I'm very very nervous... but really ready to have this baby.  Any suggestions?
title: I'm very scared about having an amnio!
